answers.answer: I believe there are studies that have shown aspirin to be effective in preventing preeclampsia.
I have to take the low dose of asprin but its not for blood pressure its to help the baby grow in my case

Yeah , that's why she prescribed me them . Because if I showed signs of having Preeclampsia again I would have to seek out a high risk doctor immediately with no questions asked. I had severe preeclampsia with my daughter!!! & it was BAD . I was just wondering if there were other mommies taking it as well?

Yes, I was on it during my first and this one due to preeclamplsia. My dr explained that it helped bloodflow through the placenta so baby continued to get enough oxygen and nutrients. I believe in both of my pregnancies it has helped my babies develop despite my declining health.

question: Has Any Of You Guys Been Told To Take Them By Your Doctor To Help Regulate Your BP?
title: **Low Aspirin?
